title: 4.2 Strassen's Algorithm for Matrix Multiplication
content:
Section 4.2

Strassen's Algorithm for Matrix Multiplication

Summary

Multiply two n×n matrices faster than O(n³) using divide-and-conquer.

Key Points

  • Standard matrix multiplication: O(n³)
  • Divide each matrix into four n/2 × n/2 submatrices
  • Naive divide-and-conquer: 8 multiplications → still O(n³)
  • Strassen's key insight: 7 multiplications suffice!
  • Time: T(n) = 7T(n/2) + O(n²) = O(n^2.81)

Example

For large matrices (n > 32), Strassen beats standard multiplication. Not used for small matrices due to overhead.

Why It Matters

Shows that seemingly optimal algorithms can sometimes be improved with clever math.
